ns2:testcase.ns3:title: CL Account Number Length Increase - Existing
ns2:testcase.ns3:description:
Online Banking shall verify that existing commercial loan account numbers shall be converted correctly and shall be viewable online.
Requirements: The BaNCS Commercial loan account number structures for new loans will be structured slightly differently than existing SHAW account numbers. The account number lengths will change. Therefore, Online and Mobile Banking will need to handle the old and new account number structures and will need to do a data migration of account numbers for loans migrated to BaNCS.
Commercial loan account number structures will change.
BaNCS account numbers can be up to 16 characters.
Loans from CLCS have account numbers of 15 characters.
The structure of BaNCS account number will vary slightly between existing SHAW loans and new loans created in BaNCS.
Online Banking Data migration is required for all loans that are migrated to BaNCS on release because the RCIF account numbers will be changed (from 14 to 15 digits with a leading zero) for any loans migrated to BaNCS on release day.
For newly created loans Online Banking and Mobile Banking will need to be able to support 16-character account numbers. (Assumption: No development required as this is already supported for Card Accounts).
ns2:testcase.ns3:creator: z004421
